text: Anti-abortion activist stops in Canton to `Harass Biden'Ex-Ohio utility regulator Sam Randazzo could face discipline for breaking attorney rulesNews Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals  LOCALAnti-abortion activist stops in Canton to `Harass Biden’Kelly Byerkelly.byer@cantonrep.comCANTON Randall Terry, his three sons and another teen anti-abortion activist stood outside St. Peter Catholic Church on Monday to denounce Joe Biden.The afternoon stop in Canton was part of a multi-state “Harass Biden Campaign” tour, which aims to dissuade Christians from voting for Biden.Terry and his crew also have asked religious leaders to speak against politicians who support abortion rights during visits to churches and cathedrals in Ohio, Pennsylvania and Delaware.“Their silence equals consent,” Terry said. “Their silence is treachery.”Terry founded Operation Rescue, which describes itself as “one of the leading pro-life Christian activist organizations in the nation.” He left the organization in the early 1990s, according to media reports, but has continued to conduct political demonstrations.Rev. John Sheridan of St. Peter Catholic Church said the parish was not aware of Terry’s visit until contacted Monday morning by The Canton Repository. He declined to make further statements for the article.Terry said he usually provides churches with a pamphlet, which compares Biden to biblical figures who killed babies, after the demonstration begins.“It’s kind of an ambush,” he said.A woman who answered the door of the church office took a pamphlet and told Terry he could call the priest but they can’t tell parishioners it’s a sin to vote for abortion rights candidates.President Donald Trump and former vice president Joe Biden have said they oppose public funding for abortions, but Biden announced last year that he no longer supports the Hyde Amendment — which bans federal funding for most abortions.Trump supports overturning Roe v. Wade and letting states determine abortion laws, according to ontheissues.org. He also became the first sitting president to attend the March for Life, an annual event to protest abortion, earlier this year in Washington, D.C.Terry also noted Trump’s “pro-life” appointments to federal courts and the Supreme Court as well as his “defunding” of Planned Parenthood.“What else could we ask for?” he said.Terry said the goal of his campaign — other than preventing Biden from becoming president — is a federal law to outlaw abortion.Reach Kelly at 330-580-8323 or kelly.byer@cantonrep.comOn Twitter: @kbyerREPCareers Staff Directory Accessibility Site Map Legals Our Ethical Principles Responsible Disclosure Subscription Terms & Conditions Terms of Service Privacy Policy Your Privacy ChoicesContact Us Support Local Business Advertise Your Business Advertising Terms and Conditions Licensing & Reprints Help Center Subscriber Guide Manage Account My Print Account Give Feedback Promote Your EventSubscribe Today Newsletters Facebook X eNewspaper ArchivesJobs Cars Homes Classifieds Reviewed.com 10Best LocaliQ Digital Marketing Solutions Events© 2024 www.cantonrep.com.
